poem:
**Morning Headlines**

The phrase "culture wars"  
flutters like a banner in the wind,  
a signal hidden in plain sight—  
a debate dressed in sharp suits,  
words sparring on the screen,  
while we sip our morning coffee,  
wondering if the battle is real  
or just specters in the fog.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Use of ‘culture wars’ phrase ‘a dog whistle to attack the right’ Badenoch tells GB News Tory leadership special – as it happened 9.58pm BST You can read our report on the debate by our senior political correspondent Peter Walker here Related: Badenoch and Jenrick spar over visions for future of Tory party in TV debate 9.51pm BST Closing summary Conservative leadership candidates Kemi Badenoch and Robert Jenrick took part in a GB News special". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Use of ‘culture wars’ phrase ‘a dog whistle to attack the right’ Badenoch tells GB News Tory leadership special – as it happened 9.58pm BST You can read our report on the debate by our senior political correspondent Peter Walker here Related: Badenoch and Jenrick spar over visions for future of Tory party in TV debate 9.51pm BST Closing summary Conservative leadership candidates Kemi Badenoch and Robert Jenrick took part in a GB News special
